summary: This document is an email chain from August 12, 2019, regarding the urgent reconstruction of inmate Jeffrey Epstein's 292 record (likely a prison administrative or movement log) for the week prior to his death. It references Epstein's death in his SHU cell and his multiple movements in and out of the SHU in the preceding weeks.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose administrative records (292 forms) are being urgently reconstructed following his death in the SHU (Special Housing Unit).

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his SHU (Special Housing Unit) cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM).

events.title: Epstein's SHU Movements
events.description: Epstein was moved in and out of the SHU three times during this period, as recorded on his 292 forms.

events.title: Reconstruction of 292 Record
events.description: A time-critical task was initiated to reconstruct Epstein's 292 administrative record for the week immediately preceding his death.

locations: SHU (Special Housing Unit) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his SHU cell on the morning of Saturday, August 10, 2019.
In the weeks prior to his death (July 7 to August 10, 2019), Epstein was moved in and out of the SHU three times.
Following his death, prison officials urgently prioritized reconstructing his 292 administrative record for the week of August 5-9, 2019.
The document is an email chain dated August 12, 2019, highlighting the immediate administrative response to Epstein's death.
